gameDetails.venue: Frost Bank Center, San Antonio, TX

recentPerformance.seasonAverage: Hawks 114.2 PPG offense, Spurs struggling at 108.1 PPG
recentPerformance.recentForm: Trae Young averaging 26.8 PPG, 11.2 APG in last 5
recentPerformance.cushion: Getting 1.5 points on road vs rebuilding team

keyFactors.title: Trae Young Elite Form
keyFactors.description: Young averaging 26.8 PPG, 11.2 APG over last 5 games. Elite playmaker who can take over games. Spurs defense ranks 24th in defensive rating - should feast.

keyFactors.title: Spurs Rebuilding
keyFactors.description: San Antonio in full rebuild mode with young roster. Wembanyama still developing. Inconsistent night-to-night. Hawks more experienced and playoff-tested.

keyFactors.title: Hawks Offensive Firepower
keyFactors.description: Atlanta averaging 114.2 PPG (#8 in NBA). Young, Murray, Johnson can all score. Should overwhelm Spurs' mediocre defense.

keyFactors.title: Small Spread Value
keyFactors.description: Only laying 1.5 points on road. If Hawks are competitive at all, they cover. Need to lose by 2+ to lose bet.

riskFactors: Wembanyama can dominate any game - generational talent
Spurs play hard at home - Frost Bank Center tough environment

traeYoung.note: Good scoring but 6 turnovers killed Hawks - Spurs scored 14 points off his TOs

victorWembanyama.note: Dominant performance - altered shots all night, Hawks couldn't score inside

devinVassell.note: Spurs' secondary scorer came up huge, hit clutch 3s in 4th

quarterBreakdown.description: Spurs came out hot at home. Wembanyama asserted himself early with 9 points. Hawks' turnovers (5) led to easy Spurs baskets.
Hawks rallied behind Trae's 12-point quarter. Took 55-54 lead at half. Defense tightened up, forced Spurs into tough shots.
Wembanyama dominated - 14 points in quarter. Hawks went cold from 3 (1-8). Spurs took 86-80 lead into 4th.
Hawks couldn't close gap. Vassell hit back-to-back 3s when Hawks got within 3. Trae's late turnover sealed it. Final: 113-106 Spurs.

gameResults.whenCleared: Lost outright by 7 points. Never led in 4th quarter. Spurs' 3rd quarter surge (outscored Hawks 32-25) created cushion Hawks couldn't overcome.
gameResults.turningPoint: Wembanyama's 3rd quarter takeover (14 points) broke the game open. Hawks had no answer inside - every close shot got altered or blocked.
gameResults.gamePace: Game played at Hawks' preferred pace (101 possessions) but turnovers killed them. 16 turnovers led to 22 Spurs points. Can't win turnover battle that badly.
gameResults.teamOffense: Hawks shot poorly (42.3%) - Wembanyama's rim protection affected everything. Only 8-29 from 3 (27.6%). Young's 6 turnovers negated his scoring.

whatWentWrong.title: Wembanyama Factor Underestimated
whatWentWrong.description: 31/12/4 blocks dominated the game. His 7'4 wingspan altered every Hawks shot inside. We knew he was talented but this was elite two-way performance.

whatWentWrong.title: Turnover Disaster
whatWentWrong.description: Hawks committed 16 turnovers leading to 22 Spurs points. Trae alone had 6. Can't win when giving away that many possessions.

whatWentWrong.title: 3-Point Shooting Collapsed
whatWentWrong.description: 8-29 (27.6%) from deep. Hawks live and die by 3-point shooting. When they go cold, offense stagnates. Spurs' length bothered shooters.

whatWentWrong.title: Rebounding Dominated
whatWentWrong.description: Spurs won rebounding 47-38. Second chance points hurt Hawks. Wembanyama grabbed 12 boards - Hawks couldn't keep him off glass.

statisticalContext.vsSeasonAverage: Hawks scored 106 vs 114.2 PPG average. Spurs defense held them 8 points below average - significant.
statisticalContext.vsRecentForm: Trae's 28 points below his 31.2 PPG last 5 games. 6 turnovers way above his 3.2 average.
statisticalContext.vsPropLine: Lost by 7 - needed to lose by 1 or win. Not close. Spurs controlled final 18 minutes.
statisticalContext.percentileRanking: Wembanyama's 31/12/4 blocks ranked 95th percentile for his performances. Hawks 3PT% ranked 15th percentile.

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: Partially. Wembanyama's dominance was exceptional but predictable given his trajectory. However, Hawks' turnover issues (16) and shooting collapse (27.6% from 3) were unusual. This was combination of generational talent showing up + Hawks playing poorly on road. Thesis of Hawks firepower beating Spurs defense didn't materialize when Wembanyama locked them down.

closingLineValue.verdict: Slight negative CLV. Line moved slightly toward Hawks but we still lost. Market was approximately right on this game. Small spread was trap - Spurs were live at home.

keyTakeaways: Wembanyama is generational - can single-handedly change game outcomes
Young rebuilding teams at home can still compete hard
Hawks' turnover issues are real concern - 16 TOs is season pattern
Small road spreads can be traps - need to win outright usually
3-point variance kills Hawks when shots don't fall
Rim protection affects Hawks more than most - they attack inside a lot
Need to respect Spurs at home - Frost Bank Center is tough
verdict: Loss due to Wembanyama dominance and Hawks self-destruction. Thesis was reasonable - Hawks offense vs bad Spurs defense - but didn't account for Wemby's rim protection impact (4 blocks, altered 10+ shots). Hawks also beat themselves with 16 turnovers and 27.6% 3PT shooting. This is learning experience: generational talents like Wembanyama can flip games, and small road spreads are often traps. Hawks need to clean up turnover issues to be reliable bet.
